title: The Heart Machine - BEEEG Fire!
description:
The Order of the Machinists invites you to bring your BFFs: Blankets, Fur & Friends. Come lay on the playa within the Heart Machine for a night of choreographed fire!  

Every other night the Heart Machine operates by will of the people and their interactions with its nervous system.  For one special night the Order of the Machinists will take over the Heart Machine and treat our Metropolis citizens to a choreographed fire show. 

The Heart Machine needs human contact and interaction so we welcome you to sit, lay, cuddle, hug or raise your voices within the perimeter of the Heart Machine.  Come bask in the heat - and there will be heat - of our 14 foot tall flaming arteries.  Did we mention these arteries shoot fire ranging from 2 feet to 20 feet?  Did we warn you about the sonic booms Canadian made solenoids make; who needs smoke signals when we can communicate with booms the sound of kettle drums?  

The Order of the Machinists hail from Ontario Canada and the Heart Machine is our gift to you: our Black Rock City community.  It's always good to come home!

If you have extra 100LB propane tanks you wish to donate for the night (we will give them back) we may event make larger and longer sonic flaming booms to keep you warm.
print_description: Come lay on the playa within the Heart Machine for choreographed fire! The Order of the Machinists invites you to bring your blankets, fur & friends.

title: The Heart of Now
description:
The essence of the Heart of Now is the practice of being present with your whole self. In The Heart of Now workshop, you’ll come to know yourself more deeply. You’ll discover the possibility of reconnection with your innate beauty, wholeness and be honest with yourself and and with others in a safe circle of love. You can discover those places you’ve felt stuck, while you are supported in letting go. You learn to become aware of those times when you get in your own way, and come to see the choices open to you. You embrace what you desire the most, and deeply commit to letting your dreams and your visions be more important than you past wounds. 

You will find yourself reconnecting with your innate beauty, wholeness and power in each moment.

Heart of Now workshops include numerous assistants to support you and to create a sacred space for transformation. A deeply nurturing environment is created. This teamwork approach deepens the experience of service and camaraderie, where all are able to experience their vulnerabilities, allowing trust and growth. For questions visit our website www.HeartOfNow.org.
print_description: The Heart of Now is the practice of being present with your whole self. In The Heart of Now workshop, you’ll come to know yourself more deeply.

title: The Misting Dome
description: Cool off in the Misting Dome, your oasis in the Black Rock Desert! Soothe yourself under the 10 powerful misting spays filled with pure Sierra snowmelt, obtained from a 9000 ft mountain spring. After your mist, head over to our adjacent Oasis Wine Bar and relax in the shade with a glass of wine or water. A massage bed will be available to anyone who cares to give/receive a moment of restful pampering. When the sun sets, misting ends and the the black lights come on, illuminating the beautiful "River of Time" mural. The Poi pond comes alive with hula hoopers, poi spinners and light background music.

title: The Movement Minyan
description:
The Movement Minyan is an opportunity to physically experience a specific theme within the dynamics of Jewish prayer, informed by movement arts like contact improvisation, authentic movement and yoga.

Each session focuses on individual prayer (tefillat yachid) versus communal prayer (tefillat tzibbur) through different approaches to tefillah modeled in Jewish liturgy, including the structures of "follow the leader", "call and response", "praying alone together" and "praying together".
print_description: An opportunity to physically experience specific themes within the dynamics of Jewish prayer, exploring different approaches through movement arts.

title: The Scarab Project
description: The Scarab project is a mobile creature containing space for chillaxin but within the wings resides a rhythm section eager to generate music for the masses.  The scarab is an ancient symbol used to reflect eternity and the never-ending cycle of life.  In terms of the Metropolis, let us not drift too far from our roots in the natural world and instead remain tied to the rhythm of change of the hour, season, years, etc...  At this year's Burning Man Experience, we will utilize the Scarab as a focal point for choreographed performance and spontaneous musical creations.  Please join us for the unfolding for each sunrise at the Camp of the Rising Sun!
print_description: The scarab carries the sun across the horizon.  Join us for inspiration and honoring of the constancy of life's natural rhythm.
other_location: Feel free to join in for spontaneous playa adventures

title: The SEED of LOVE Dispensary
description:
In need of some LOVE? Aren't we all?! Come have a consultation with one of our Licensed Lovers who will diagnose and prescribe the precise brand of LOVE your Playa experience is calling for. The Seed dispenses infinite varieties of LOVE known and yet unknown....Unconditional Nurturing, Tough LOVE, Agape LOVE, Adoration, Affection...
We've got the LOVE you need!
While you're receiving, enjoy an iced cold Kombucha (bring a cup!), catch a Daytime Dance Party, play a round of Drop Your Baggage, and stay for a workshop. We LOVE you!!!
print_description: Need some LOVE? Don't we all?! Have a consultation w/one of our Licensed Lovers who'll diagnose and prescribe the precise brand of LOVE you need!

Shirtcockers & Skirtcunters unite! Join us for drinks & homebrew. Jackets required, pants optional. 

The ShirtCock Saloon offers the finest in no-pants entertainment for all. Didn't bring your best smoking jacket? No worries, we've got a coat for you. Never shirtcocked or skirtcunted? Lessons provided! Otherwise, dress accordingly and come on by for the best in formal shirtcocking complete with whiskey bar and homebrew. Music and dancing too, if you've got the swing...

Look for the lit up chariot out front and the ShirtCock Saloon sign on the door and come on in.

title: The Temple of Imperfections
description:
Got an imperfection that's holding you back? Try plastic surgery playa-style! On-the-spot consultations & treatment. No waiting! No huge hospital bills! 100% refund if you're not 100% satisfied!
Pain-free and no sedation required.
Through this revolutionary treatment representing a breakthrough in not-so-modern technology, your imperfections will be captured in the temple so that you are free to relax and enjoy a perfect burn.
Leave your imperfections with us and celebrate as they go up in smoke on Sunday at 7pm.
print_description: Got an imperfection that's holding you back? Try plastic surgery playa-style! On-the-spot consultations & treatment. Leave your imperfections with us!

title: The Tick Tock Company Co
description:
I have a small computer graveyard in my closet, and I bet I’m not the only one. Do you have an old laptop or keyboard and monitor taking up space? Put it to good use!

Imagine blocks of skyscrapers filled with little rooms where people, much like you and I spend most of their waking hours – moving their digits across letters on plastic pads with symbols on them.

Our tools are now more advanced, with many flavors of computing, input and output devices, most of which are connected. These devices, and the possibilities they open up, have (with our help of course) developed marvelously diverse ways of subtly thieving away more and more of our time. Any metropolis today represents an ever-evolving symbiosis with technology.

Helps us explore this topic on-Playa in 3 easy steps:
1. Bring an old laptop or monitor/keyboard with you to Black Rock City this year.
2. Show up at 7PM on Friday at the halfway point between the Man and Center Camp along the 6 o’clock avenue.
3. We ask that you sit down forming a grid and look busy, typing for 20-25 minutes,

We will work with the town of Gerlach to set up techno-trash bins you can use on the way out, or if your device still works after the playa treatment, look into donating it to the Gerlach school district.

More details to come, but the core of the idea is really rather simple. Let's do a little exploration of how modern humans spend their time on this planet.
Thoughts and ideas, and of course participation are very welcome.
print_description: Any metropolis today represents an ever-evolving symbiosis with technology. Lets explore how this effects how humans spend their time on planet Earth.
other_location: 6 O'clock Road, halfway between Center Camp and the Man

Just inside, you'll discover the V-SPoT, where our Volunteer Experts will help you find your "special place" in Black Rock City. Volunteer Coordinators from all the coolest Burning Man departments come to the V-Spot with their special needs. Are you big enough to fill them? Let us show you your V-Spot: this won't hurt a bit! In fact, we're sure you'll love it!

title: Thoughts on Healing
description: Almost all of us have something in our lives that we would like to heal. For some it is the challenges of a disease or a physical or mental health condition. For others it is a memory or imprint from our past, a relationship or trauma in our present, or the projection about an anxiety or dread of a future event or situation. This workshop will look at how we can and do use our thinking and subconscious imprints to cause unwanted challenges or create unimaginable healing. A limited number of individual session will be available throughout the week by appointment.
print_description: Look at how we can and do use our thinking and subconscious imprints to cause unwanted challenges or create unimaginable healing.

title: Throat Singing
description:
Throat Singing sounds like a didgeridoo, only anyone can do it without any instrument at all. 
Learn several Tuvan styles of singing one of which is also used by Buddhist monks as well. 
Women and men can both throat sing naturally. 
Through listening and instruction you'll  learn one or more of these different styles and how to combine them.
I also have been combining throat singing with beat boxing. This is a lot of fun and adds an awesome dimension to beat boxing. 
Once you learn to do it, and become proficient at it, you can throat sing into a didgeridoo and the resonant tones produce and amazing sometimes hypnotic affect.

Come by Camp Gratitude during the day and ask if RememberZ is available. If you catch me in one of many free moments we'll have a lesson. There will also be specific scheduled events as well.
print_description: Hear and learn various different throat singing styles with coaching. Anytime you can find Remember Z at Camp Gratitude. I'll give you a lesson. =)

title: Time for tea afternoon tea party
description: Afternoon tea hosted by a group of eccentric English ladies and gents.  Hand crafted menu's will include Tea served from vintage tea pots and cups, afternoon tea will include tea, cake, finger sandwiches and cream tea.   All served with lashings of surreal mismatch mayhem juxtaposed with traditional english tea ceremony. Tea will be served by gents in tails and top hats and girls in vintage tea dresses. Music will be straight from a 1940's tea dance, played from a well loved gramophone.    Come join in the tea party extravaganza and find a slice of quintessential british charisma in the outback of the American desert.   We will offer a workshop on the Art of Making the Perfect Cup of Tea.
print_description: Afternoon tea hosted by a group of eccentric English ladies and gents. All served with lashings of surreal mismatch and mayhem.

title: Tiny Tropolis Mixer
description: Imagine, if you will, a 160 foot long row of 100 identical white boxes stretching out into the middle of the desert. No this is not a mirage. This my friends is Tiny Tropolis. A collaborative Burning Man art installation for 2010's burn that is truly international. We've assembled a crackerjack team of over 100 Tiny Artists from states all over the US as well as from Ireland, England, Canada, and New Zealand. Each artist has their own creative vision for their own Tiny installation and together we unite to form Tiny Tropolis, the tiniest little city of dioramas in the world!
print_description: Come meet the artists of Tiny Tropolis!

title: Tissue and a Plan
description: Lost? Confused? Runny nose? Don't know what to go do next? Camp Tissue and a Plan is dedicated to making sure no burner wanders the playa without a clear plan and a clean tissue. All week long we will have a goodly supply of tissues each with a different plan written on them. We figure that every burner could use a spare tissue, and many could have anywhere from casual to dire need of a plan. Come on by to grab your tissue and a plan. Or help us make more!

title: Tour de Fence!
description: Join renegade cyclist camp Garden Chillicious for this tour de force Tour de Fence. We will be meeting at 7am (yes 7am!) at the Man, fully attired in our Tour uniforms waving our respective flags. Bring your "tour" bike, yourself, your best nut-hugging bike shorts and some water. Represent your country, your camp or yourself as we journey the entire length of the Trash Fence via bike. Power snacks and specially formulated energy enhancing beverages will be provided. title: Tourist Day
description: Returning for our second year, bigger and badder then ever before.  What's the scariest thing on the Playa... Ok, other then herpes?  That's right the gawd damn tourists.  So once again this year we will  be out in force out-louding, and out-obnoxiousing them preemptively.  So slip on your black socks with sandals, your big floppy hats and  your loudest Hawaiian shirt and come join us, because what's ten times  more fun then 20 tourists? 200 tourists, of course.  Guided tour  leaves from camp R&U.  Say it loud, say it proud... "Can anybody tell  me where the dadgum gift shop is?" and make sure to bring a camera for  way too many photo-ops with the natives.
print_description: What's the scariest part of BurningMan? The tourists! So grab your black socks & sandals and let's out-obnoxious them, preemptively. Bring a camera.

title: Transforming the Immature Male
description: Thursday (men) and Friday (coed) at 3: Transforming the Immature Male: where are we blocked, stuck and unrealized, immature and in need of refinement? what are the qualities of the immature/profane man (i.e.controlling, rigid, undependable, emasculated, weak...) and how do we confront and transform these base qualities into gold? ... what is our work as men and how do we support each other in realizing our fullest potentials and transmitting our greatest gifts? by Morph
print_description: Thursday(men) & Friday(coed): where are we blocked, stuck and in need of refinement and how do we confront and transform these base qualities to Gold.

title: Travel Stories and Tips
description: Wanderlust? Like to travel? Have some great travel tales? Wanna share voyage wisdom, tidbits or advice for other travelers? Couch Burners are seasoned travelers from different international metropolises. We stay on couches, floors, chairs, hammocks, beds, futons, stairs, cars, tents... where ever we find good people and good fun. Hear about some of our travel tales and tell us yours. Find out some of the best non-touristy things to do in cities. Learn about what NOT to miss in cities. Discover a special drink from a city. We can tell you how to get to whatever metropolis you desire (and might know of a couch for you to stay on there?)
print_description: Wanderlust? Have travel tales? Wanna share voyage wisdom? Pick up tips? Find a couch to travel to? Join us for drinks & conversations. Make friends.

title: True Mirror Palace Artist's Talk
description:
True Mirror Explained!  Every day at 12 noon, the artist Exactly will give a talk on the origins and deeper purpose of the amazing True Mirror - the only mirror that can reflect your true, natural self.  Hear how he discovered and  perfected it, why its so different, and how to see the magic in it for you.  The implications for both personal growth and societal balance from removing one of the key distortions of self knowledge will be explored. 

Also, the (in)famous Hair Part Theory will be talked about, which explains why some people are so out of balance and why we have such a polarized culture.  The real reason why Al Gore lost the election, why Carter is a much better past president, why Andy Rooney, Steve Martin, Hitler, Blagoyovich and many other entertainment and political characters are so unusual, all find explanations with the way they part their hair. and of course, how mirrors have been fooling them even more so because they reflect the opposite hair part!
print_description: The artist Exactly will speak on the origins & deeper purpose of the amazing True Mirror - the only mirror that can reflect your true, natural self.

title: Tune-up Yoga
description: This exercise series is called Tune-up Yoga. It is a hybrid practice combining Yoga, Qi Gong, strength training, and healing to construct an effective, energy producing routine that uses isometric exercises to build muscle capability and core strength, while providing a sturdy platform for those muscles to operate from.  The routine focusses primarily on connecting the shoulders and hips to their associated muscle groups, and is an excellent departure point for peoples own search for health through a variety of healing practices - which are presented within the routine in an introductory manner. The benefits of this exercise style are most noticeable by those who perform tasks such as construction, labor, and computer work, or those who just want a tune-up.

title: Unicorn Stampede
description:
The Unicorn Ranch is a group of Unicorns who come every year from the Enchanted Forest to play at Burningman. We bring magick and innocence to the playa and we fart butterflies and poop rainbows. There is a rumor that we eat bunnies, and it is true, but only with their consent.
In the Enchanted Forest we are always having big lovely orgies with our friends. We like orgies, and we are always horny!!
This year, for the first time, we are having a stampede, taking our unbridled joy and annoyingly perky enthusiasm across the playa. Join us! We will be galloping around making a nuisance of ourselves, stampeding through people's camps spreading our intolerably positive energy throughout the festival. We will start at the Unicorn Ranch at Esplanade and 3.45, gathering from 5-6pm, and then stampeding around who knows where as the sun sets. We will provide horns and other unicorny costuming to those who are horn deficient. We really can't wait to meet you! Squeeeee!
print_description: The Unicorn Ranch is so excited for our 1st Stampede we're pooping little rainbow pellets of joy! We will make you horny!(and give you a horn).Yeay!
other_location: Esplanade and 3.45 at the Unicorn Ranch

title: Unified Harmonic Matrix
description: In this follow-up to the Sacred Geometry & the Chakras course on Wednesday, we go deeper into the holographic nature of the universe through physical representations in the Microcosm, Biocosm, Metacosm, and Macrocosm. We will explore the way that every layer of existence is highly connected and tuned to every other layer, and follows the same patterns and principles regardless of the scale. This workshop provides extremely useful keys for magical and healing applications, and essential knowledge for any seeker of universal wisdom. The symbiotic holographic structures shared here cannot be found in any other teaching or book currently available.
print_description: Explore the holographic nature of existence & being through physical representations in the Microcosm, Biocosm, Metacosm, & Macrocosm by Adam Apollo

title: Unity Through Currency
description: Shaman Joshua teaches the most ancient of technologies "Symbiosis" or "unity through currency". Learn how to destroy all the world banks with a single keystroke of the computer. Learn the ancient Alchemical secret of money creation, the end of duality, the Holy Trinity, Merkaba Ascension, and the creation of our credit commons. 1worldcurrency.net is the vehicle to global citizenship and the key to return the earth to a state of abundance and deliver us into a gifting economy. Learn about the creation of community currencies and how we can provide for the needs of all humans on the planet and not have to borrow the money from the Federal Reserve.

title: Universal Babel Service
description:

Forgot how to use a pen? 
Need a little help writing that difficult letter? 
Communicate as our ancestors did with paper correspondence!
Bring your little black book and a story to tell.  Dictate a letter to one of our Babelers and watch as your words get typed onto the page with an ancient technology known as the "typewriter"!    We’ll deliver your letter via messenger throughout Black Rock City or post them to the default world using beautiful vintage stamps.

title: Wandering Hands Piano Bar
description:
The Wandering Hands Piano Bar is a roving orchestra built around a giant piano built around a Ford F250 pickup truck. The piano is fully functional (via electronic keyboard) and has a bench wrapping around one of its sides for musicians to sit on. Our intent is to around the playa, searching out musical, artistic, vocal, and spoken word collaborators, and creating dynamic collaborative music. We'd like to record some of these collaborations, and give mixed CDs out on playa on Sunday or via the Internet after the festival.

True to its name, the Wandering Hands Piano Bar is also a bar, so we invite those who would like to sit back and listen to the music to climb inside the piano into the central seating area and enjoy a fine concoction from our bartender.
print_description: Roving orchestra built around a giant piano looking for musical, singing, and spoken word collaborators.

The rules are simple:  Everyone takes a colored sash and gets in line with their color's team, facing the opposite team as the music plays.  Water Pistols must be holstered.  When the music stops, DRAW!

title: wdydwyd?
description: COLLABORATIVE ART PROJECT & EXHIBIT. // Come get your portrait made and have a conversation with others about why you do what you do. Or sign up to be a photographer or "conversationalist" to talk with people about why they do what they do. // The "wdydwyd?" project started at Burning Man in 2004. Over 1,000 Burners are featured answering, "Why do you do what you do?" on the playa. Burners have spread this meme around the world, prompting 10,000 people to answer the question. // The past few years, we've collaborated with a few dozen photographers and artists with different styles (including digital and video). These are presented in the exhibit on the back fence surrounding Center Camp. // If you want to collaborate as a photographer or a "conversationalist" sign up here: http://wdydwyd.com/bmshoot // This project a great way to meet new burners, participate in a collaborative art project as a photographer or as someone who is just interested in having meaningful conversations with fellow Burners about their passions and motivations. // Or, if you just want to have your portrait made for future exhibits on the playa, come double check the schedule on the exhibit for the most up-to-date times when collaborating photographers will be there.
print_description: Portraits of 1000s of Burners answering, "Why do you do what you do?" Get your portrait made. Check schedule on exhibit for times to be photographed.
other_location: Center Camp @6:30 exit next to back fence surrounding CC

title: What are those 5Rhythms Anyway? w/Douglas Drummond
description: Want to know more about Gabrielle Roth’s 5Rhythms movement practice? Come to this 90-minute class and be gently guided through each of the rhythms: flowing, staccato, chaos, lyrical and stillness. Each rhythm focuses on a simple movement quality rather than a specific form or set of steps, giving everyone the freedom to move in ways that feel authentic without any pressure to get it right. With a little instruction, the experience of the 5Rhythms® opens us deeply and helps us move beyond self-consciousness to an authentic connection to our body and life force. Using the discipline of each rhythm and the breath as a catalyst for movement, you will be invited to embody, follow, express, and release your own energy. In the end, you will find yourself renewed and reconnected to your own self, feeling fully alive. Taught by Douglas Drummond
print_description: Want to know more about Gabrielle Roth’s 5Rhythms movement practice?  Come to this 90-minute class and be gently guided through each of the rhythms.

title: Where are you?: Map your place
description:
Come find out about this project and describe your own camp! Bring photos if you can!

This multi-year project is a cross-disciplinary approach to studying Black Rock City and its inhabitants during the Burning Man Festival. Combining traditional archaeological methods with ethnographic approaches, researchers are collecting and analyzing information about the construction, use, and understanding of the physical environment and the lives and interactions of people within that temporary city. Archaeological methods consist of survey, mapping of individual camps, and surface collection of the city as constructed during the festival. This data will be combined with the results of data collection from the clean-up efforts overseen by the Bureau of Land Management. Ethnographic methods include structured and open-ended interviews, participant observation, virtual ethnography, discourse analysis, and secondary research.  Ethnographic findings will be integrated with archaeological data to present a holistic study of Burning Man. In merging archaeological and ethnographic approaches, this project combines analysis of the physical elements of the city with an exploration of the meanings of space and the festival in larger context. Research questions address the creation, use, and significance of physical space and place, the relationship between participants and their environment, temporality and change in ritual practice, and perceptions of self in relation to the landscape.  This collaborative project focuses on the materiality and cultural expressions of Burning Man, aiming to uncover the intersecting ethereal and material dimensions of the festival and to study the event's significance for those who create, reside in, and deconstruct Black Rock City.
print_description: Describe and record the “places” you make and reside in at Burning Man with a cultural anthropologist and archaeologist from the University of Nevada.

description:
The Whispering Wall invites you to write your hopes, dreams, fears, secrets and wishes onto a scroll that will become a manifestation of the intent of the citizens of BRC. Whisper someone else's hope, dream or wish into the echoing Hall that "remembers" your voice, repeating it throughout the week. Bask in the dappled light of the Hall's lattice under its three archways, and enjoy the sounds of the wind harp and the soft melody of voices.

Our intention is to create a place that rises from the desert landscape and embodies both the natural environment, and the future we are co-creating as active proponents of radical self-expression.  

Attend later in the evening to revel in the sounds of the magnificent fire organs.
print_description: Write your hopes, dreams, fears, secrets and wishes onto our scroll. Whisper someone else's into the echoing Hall that "remembers" you.

title: Wielding and Yielding Power
description: Saturday (men) and Sunday (coed) at 3: Wielding and Yielding Power: How do we as men experience power? How skillfully and intentionally do we wield the power we have? How do we share power with other men? With women? How able are we to surrender and yield to others? How able are we to be vulnerable, to ask for help and express our feelings and needs? Do we get defensive when we are hearing something we don't want to hear? How big is our love and how strong are we at holding our ground when we need to?

title: WITNESS PROTECTION CONNECTION
description:
Come by The Witness Protection Connection: A Dating Service for the Personae non Gratae and pick up a silk flower that represents your sexual preference: white for hetero; red for bi; blue for gay; pink for lesbian; or yellow for transgendered. Attach it to your backpack, bike, wrist, or wear it your hair if you would like. Then, as you travel around the city during the rest of the week, keep an eye out for another person wearing a flower in your color. If there is an attraction, go ahead and introduce yourself to that person and if that certain chemistry continues to develop, invite him or her to meet you at the Sleepless In Black Rock City Night party at the Booby Bar in the Terminal City Village right after the burn on Saturday night. Pretty romantic, right?
Supplies will be somewhat limited so don't wait! Come visit us early in the week for the best selections and the longest/most opportunities to meet that someone special. We'll be right next door to The Booby Bar every afternoon/evening until the party for that night gets started. See you there!
print_description: Get a silk flower in your color. Look for another flower in your color. Invite that person to meet you after the burn at The Booby Bar. How romantic!

title: WoW Addicts Recovery Meeting
description:
Wait, we have to go a whole week without logging in to play computer games? Better believe by Saturday there's a lot of us going to be jonesing for our fix. That doesn't just apply to those of us in camp, there's thousands of people out on the playa that will be getting the mouse-hand shakes by the weekend. Since popping up the laptop and logging on isn't an option, we'll just have ourselves an addiction party instead.

Open to all everyone, gamer or not, we'll have a little gathering Saturday afternoon. Anyone who has completed our daily quests, or just wants to hang out and get their fix is welcome. Our resident mad alchemist has come up with some special brews, and servings of delicious chocolate cake are available to all. If any of our "Dragonbreath" chili remains, it's a great time to polish that off. Hang out, drink some "kungaloosh", take down a "sulfuron slammer", and swap war stories of "How I wiped the 40 man raid".
print_description: Missing your druid?  Or your pally?  Want to argue that Horde is better, Ally scum!!? Stop by and enjoy some conversation and WoW themed foods.

title: Yoga to Free Your Voice
description:
We are all singers. Weaving our reality through the power of our creative expression. We are all gifted with voices that need to be heard.
This experience is a blend of Hatha Flow Yoga and Vocal technique, designed to gently release any inhibitions or blocks to complete freedom of expression in a fun and celebratory environment.
 Appropriate for all levels, accessible to people who have never sung a note yet still helpful for professional singers; the combination of specific Yoga Asanas and flows with vocal training exercises will increase your breath capacity and awareness, develop your range, resonance, and most importantly confidence, and give you the skills to sing safely, and sustainably.
This is a joyful experience of healing and empowerment, accessing and expressing your authentic self through movement and sound,  training your greatest instrument, and learning to be a YES!
print_description: Let the world hear your beauty, and learn to fully and freely express. A blend of Hatha Flow and Vocal training. All levels. Taught by Niema Lightseed

title: Zaireeka Party: Experiments w/Sound Revival
description:
Zaireeka Listening Party: Experiments with Sound, Revival
Zaireeka is the eighth studio album by the alternative rock band The Flaming Lips. Released on October 28, 1997, the experimental rock album consists of four compact discs. Each of its eight songs consists of four stereo tracks, one from each CD. The album was designed so that when played simultaneously on four separate audio systems, the four CDs would produce a harmonic or juxtaposed sound. The discs may be included in different combinations, omitting one, two or three discs. The album's title is a portmanteau of two words: Zaire, chosen as a symbol of anarchy after Wayne Coyne heard a radio news story about the political instability of the African nation, and eureka (literally: "I have found it"), an expression of joyous discovery.
Since its release a fifth disc has been added, adding a new element to the experiment.
Leading up to it's release, the Lips would conduct parking garage, and ballroom experiments using car stereos and boom boxes to coordinate massive simultaneous sound experiments using the sounds that would eventually become Zaireeka.
I propose to invite any interested booxbox/ mp3player toting burners to bring along their audio device, I will distribute the 5 discs (sets of mp3s) to everyone, divided up into groups, and (huddle into the dome perhaps) for some freaked out sounds. i will act as conductor, signaling when each group is to crank their disc, etc. we can try can waves of volume, mix up groups, or keep them segregated, their are many options left open for these wacky tracks!
print_description: Bring your cd/mp3 BoomBox for a Freakout to this multi source sound experiment celebrating the glorius 1997 release by the Flaming Lips.

title: 師猿_ShiZaru's Evolving Ema: 改善(KaiZen)
description:
After a regeneration period post temple sacrifice in BM'09 (Hope), ShiZaru's Evolving Ema (interactive art exhibit Y2) revied & successfully debuted at NYC Decom'09 as 改善(KAIZEN) with prompts this year that ask participants to reflect on the state of their metropolis through the lens of KaiZen, or continual improvement. Throughout the '09-'10 BM year, the Ema has appeared at numerous BM & community events, underground parties and fundraisers. Ema contributions from this past year will be incorporated as part of this year's installation on playa & after combined with the new Emas created by the denizens of our BRC in 2010, will again be sacrificed at the temple burn. 

All are encouraged to come & seek or share enlightenment, as well as support the production, care and ceremonies that will be undertaken this BM'10. Do please visit, reflect and if inspired, contribute by adding UR creation.
print_description: ShiZaru's Evolving Ema: KaiZen! is coming back to the Tokyo side of the playa. Find her across the esplanade from KK (8:30), & do come to participate.

There will even be a special surprise that is gonna give u the most awesome bassface, so if you like your Dub, are hankering for a multi-sensory and wobble inducing ride, cum feel the 津波~Tsunami Bass Experience Friday night @ Kostume Kult on playa.
